$$

$$
\det(A) = (8)(7) - (11)(3) = 56 - 33 = 23
$$

Now, we need to find the multiplicative inverse of the determinant modulo 26. In other words, we need to find a number x such that:

$$
23x \equiv 1 \pmod{26}
$$

By trying different values, we find that x = 17 satisfies this condition:

$$
23 \cdot 17 = 391 \equiv 1 \pmod{26}
$$

Now we can find the inverse of the matrix A modulo 26:

$$
A^{-1} = 17 \cdot \begin{pmatrix}
7 & -11\\
-3 & 8
\end{pmatrix} \pmod{26}
$$

$$
A^{-1} = \begin{pmatrix}
119 & -187\\

$$

$$
A^{-1} = \begin{pmatrix}
15 & 7\\
1 & 2
\end{pmatrix}
$$

Now we can decrypt the message by multiplying the inverse of the matrix A by the encrypted message:

$$
A^{-1} \cdot \begin{pmatrix}
23\\
4
\end{pmatrix} =
\begin{pmatrix}
15 & 7\\

$$

$$
\begin{pmatrix}

$$
